Problem:
Consider a control system where the state vector \\(x(t)\\) evolves according to the linear time-invariant system \\(\\dot{x} = Ax + Bu\\), with A and B being constant matrices and \\(u(t)\\) an input vector. We are interested in examining the effects of implementing an input transformation \\(u(t) = D v(t)\\), where D is a constant matrix and \\(v(t)\\) represents a new transformed input.

If an additional transformation \\(v(t) = E w(t)\\) (where E is another constant matrix) is applied as an intervention at a certain time \\(t_1\\), will the endpoint \\(x(T)\\) for T > t_1 depend solely on A but not on B, D, or E?
Explanation: The intervention with \\(v(t) = E w(t)\\) adds another layer of input modification, affecting the final state \\(x(T)\\) depending on B, D, and E, as well as the system matrix A. Each of these transformations impact how the control input shapes the evolution of the state vector.
